content.description:
The polar function consists of four loops, upper right, lower right, upper left, lower left, each of which begins at the origin, the center of the polar grid.

All four loops are the same size are shape. The loops are symmetric with respect to the axes and the origin.

The loop on the upper right moves from the origin, upward and to the right, passing radii of 2, 4, and beyond, to a maximum distance from the polar axis on the radius 6.

From the maximum distance from the polar axis on the radius 6, the loop on the upper right moves downward and to the right slightly, before the loop moves downward and to the left, passing through the radii of 4 and 2, until it reaches the origin.

The loop on the lower right is a reflection of the loop on the upper right over the polar axis.

The loop on the upper left is a reflection of the loop on the upper right over the vertical axis.

The loop on the lower left is a reflection of the loop on the upper right over the origin.

The figure shows the graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></math>, for <math alttext="0 less or equal than theta less or equal than 2 pi"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></math>, in the polar coordinate system.
content.question: Which of the following could be an expression for <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses"> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mi>θ</mi> </mfenced> </math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="6 cos open parentheses 4 theta close parentheses"><mn>6</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="6 cos open parentheses 2 theta close parentheses"><mn>6</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="6 sin open parentheses 4 theta close parentheses"><mn>6</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="6 sin open parentheses 2 theta close parentheses"><mn>6</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="6 sin open parentheses 2 theta close parentheses"><mn>6</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>
